definition: root of the trouble/cause of the ruin
old variant of 禍|祸[huo4]
disaster/misfortune/calamity
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)

sentences.english: His wealth proved a curse to him.
This is both a blessing and a curse.
sentences.chinese: 这既是一种幸运也是一个祸根。

sentences.english: Wet of fine, weeds are always regarded as the bane of a horticulturist's life.
sentences.chinese: 不管天晴下雨，杂草对园艺家来说总是祸根。

sentences.english: The show's popularity has also been a curse.
sentences.chinese: 节目的流行反而成了祸根。

sentences.english: Sagoro's greatest bane was his criminal older brother, Venco.
sentences.chinese: 萨戈罗最大的祸根就是他的罪犯哥哥文科。

sentences.english: What happened at Hockenheim must have rung bells with you.
sentences.chinese: 祸根海姆的事一定让你回想起什么。

sentences.english: Indeed, central banks laid the foundations for today's stagflation.
sentences.chinese: 的确，为今天的滞胀种下祸根的正是各国央行。

sentences.english: On the other side, there were those who branded them as the “curse” of the nation.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，又有人污蔑他们是这个国家的“祸根”。

sentences.english: The exclusive right of the Empress Dowager Dou he was very angry, and determined to get rid of this curse for the country.
sentences.chinese: 对窦太后的专权他十分气愤，决心为国除掉这一祸根。

sentences.english: In some cases historic resentments are at the base.
sentences.chinese: 在某些情况下，历史积怨埋下了祸根。

sentences.english: But alcohol was to be his undoing.
sentences.chinese: 但酒精注定是他的祸根。

sentences.english: Avarice is the bane to happiness.
sentences.chinese: 贪婪是损毁幸福的祸根。

definition: disaster/calamity
evil consequence/retribution (in Buddhism)
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
criminal ringleader, main offender (idiom); main culprit/fig. main cause of a disaster
lit. to nurture a tiger invites calamity/fig. to indulge one's enemy is asking for trouble (idiom)
chief offender/main culprit
criminal ringleader/chief culprit/fig. cause of a problem
disaster/calamity
disaster/harm/scourge/bad person/to damage/to harm/to wreck
to eat one's own fruit (idiom); fig. suffering the consequences of one's own action/to reap what one has sown
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
calamity and chaos/devastating disorder/great turmoil
a danger concealed within sth/hidden damage/misfortune not visible from the surface
to have disastrous consequences
lit. calamity within one's bosom (idiom); major trouble hidden within
accomplice/accessory
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
